title: Where is xin zhou's horse?
body: In almost all of his splash arts he is mounted, is there a reason why? No other characters are pictured mounted unless they have a mount

replies.body:
Most likely because it looks cool.
Though I think it would be awesome if he'd get a horse once he gets an update(not sure if a mere gameplay update would be able to do this though)

But Hecarim already fulfills the "Dragoon" archetype. 

Xin on a horse would be perfect though.

Hecarim is a centaur and while that is similar to a cavalerist,it isn't the same thing.(if anything I'd say that Kled is the one who fills the cavalerist-archetype the best)

And overall I wouldn't say that Xin should be a completely mounted combatant,maybe he could use the horse for transport between battles?(though that could be a bit similar to Quinns ult)
I meant in how Hecarim charges in quickly like a dragoon cavalryman.

Well Kled also charges into the enemies.
And anyway there are multiple ways one could give him a horse,he doesn't have to be changed into a full blown cavalier.
Good point. Though it'd be weird for him to suddenly have a horse when he charges and then it's gone.
He ate it before he got into the Rift.
Guan Yu ( SMITE ) has an ult where he Mounts his horse for 4 seconds, his autoattacks getting aoe and after that he dismounts stunning enemies around him. Could be used as an idea..?

Isn't he considered trash in smite?

Idk. I just saw a joke about him.

No idea since i played smite a week and despite liking it, i lost interest. i just meant it as an idea what could be, rather then exact copying. but xin mounting for a while to Charge in would be cool

*takes a look at the splashes*

Huh, never noticed it but he is mounted in a lot of splashes.
